Posted By: NinjaShadow (1/19/2012 3:45:39 PM)

posts.post_content: This was a pretty popular card in discard decks back in the day. However, I play mostly with old cards, and I don't find this card to be that effective. Thinking in terms of 4th Edition era Magic, this can be easily bolted, killed by a relatively small Hurricane, and blocked by Wall of Air or Serra Angel. Terror, on the other hand, is not a response to this card. With the power creep these days, in terms of creatures at least, this card is not very playable at 3cc. Speaking of power creep, [Liliana's Caress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Caress) makes this a little better in that you could play the Caress the turn before you play the Hyppie. Back in the day, you would have played Hyppie on turn 3 and not played [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim) until turn 4 (barring a dark ritual of course). Either way, they're not discarding from Hyppie until turn 4. In a discard deck, you want to be on the verge of winning by turn 4.
posts.html:
This was a pretty popular card in discard decks back in the day. However, I play mostly with old cards, and I don't find this card to be that effective. Thinking in terms of 4th Edition era Magic, this can be easily bolted, killed by a relatively small Hurricane, and blocked by Wall of Air or Serra Angel. Terror, on the other hand, is not a response to this card. With the power creep these days, in terms of creatures at least, this card is not very playable at 3cc. Speaking of power creep, Liliana's Caress makes this a little better in that you could play the Caress the turn before you play the Hyppie. Back in the day, you would have played Hyppie on turn 3 and not played Megrim until turn 4 (barring a dark ritual of course). Either way, they're not discarding from Hyppie until turn 4. In a discard deck, you want to be on the verge of winning by turn 4.

posts.post_content: Greg Staples is the man, but this is not his best in my option. Still good, but the dragon is a little off of the theme. He draws better angels, [baneslayer angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=baneslayer angel), for example. Anyways, this guy is a sacred cow of magic. He sets a power and ability curve on his own, and he is an O-G. Classic black power. Art work 3/5 card is 5+/5.
